channel.title: Cloud on Chris Neales Blog
channel.description: Recent content in Cloud on Chris Neales Blog

item.title: Networking - North-South, East-West. Don't be embarrassed to ask
item.description: Networking traffic described as points of the compass. It’s day 3 of vmworld for me and NSX is big. The keynotes feature it heavily, it’s great new technology and the queues for standby to the breakout sessions where NSX is in the title are like queues for a new iPhone release. So it took me this long to stop and say, wait! What is this north south east west stuff? Everyone refers to it to talk about traffic in data centres but no one has defined it.

item.title: Comparison of Free Online Sync Providers
item.description: Spideroak Ubuntu One Dropbox SkyDrive Synced Storage iDriveSync LiveKive (AVG) Free Storage 2GB 2Gb 2Gb/8GB** 5GB 5GB 5GB Additional StorageÂ Costs 100GB/$100 20GB/$29.99 50GB/$99 100GB/$199 Unlim/$59.88 25GB/$49.99 Unlim/$79.99 PC Client Yes Yes(Beta) Yes Yes Yes Yes Linux Client Yes Yes Yes No No No Mac Client Yes No Yes Yes Yes Yes Android Client Yes Yes* Yes No No Yes iPhone Client Yes Yes* Yes No No Yes   I personally go with Dropbox as I find the client to be small and pretty unobtrusive.
